Package algorithms.statistics

Class CDFRandomSelect

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.statistics.CDFRandomSelect
  • public class CDFRandomSelect
extends java.lang.Object
    class to randomly select from the CDF of a discrete probability function.
    Author:
    nichole

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static int binarySearchForNearest​(double[] cdf, double srch, double tol)
      find the nearest value to srch in the array cdf using binary search.
      static int[] chooseKFromBinarySearch​(double[] cdf, int k, java.util.Random rand)
      choose k indexes from the cdf by randomly drawing from rand[0,1] and using binary search to find the nearest cumulative probability in the cdf, k times, returning the indexes.
      static int[] chooseKFromBinarySearch​(double[] cdf, int k, java.util.Random rand, double tolerance)
      choose k indexes from the cdf by randomly drawing from rand[0,1] and using binary search to find the nearest cumulative probability in the cdf, k times, returning the indexes.
      static int[] chooseKFromBinarySearchFloor​(double[] cdf, int k, java.util.Random rand)
      choose k indexes from the cdf by randomly drawing each time from rand[0,1] and using binary search to find the nearest cumulative probability in the cdf, then returning the index as the step that the random value truly belongs to).
      static int[] chooseKFromBinarySearchFloor​(double[] cdf, int k, java.util.Random rand, double tolerance)
      choose k indexes from the cdf by randomly drawing each time from rand[0,1] and using binary search to find the nearest cumulative probability in the cdf, then returning the index as the step that the random value truly belongs to).

    • Method Detail

      • chooseKFromBinarySearch

        public static int[] chooseKFromBinarySearch​(double[] cdf,
                                            int k,
                                            java.util.Random rand)
        choose k indexes from the cdf by randomly drawing from rand[0,1] and using binary search to find the nearest cumulative probability in the cdf, k times, returning the indexes.
        Parameters:
        cdf - cumulative distribution function. NOTE that the values should be normalized such that the last item is 1.
        k - number of random selects
        rand - random number generator
        Returns:
        indexes from randomly selected cdf distribution values

      • chooseKFromBinarySearchFloor

        public static int[] chooseKFromBinarySearchFloor​(double[] cdf,
                                                 int k,
                                                 java.util.Random rand)
        choose k indexes from the cdf by randomly drawing each time from rand[0,1] and using binary search to find the nearest cumulative probability in the cdf, then returning the index as the step that the random value truly belongs to).
        Parameters:
        cdf - cumulative distribution function. NOTE that the values should be normalized such that the last item is 1.
        k - number of random selects
        rand - random number generator
        Returns:
        indexes from randomly selected cdf distribution values

      • chooseKFromBinarySearch

        public static int[] chooseKFromBinarySearch​(double[] cdf,
                                            int k,
                                            java.util.Random rand,
                                            double tolerance)
        choose k indexes from the cdf by randomly drawing from rand[0,1] and using binary search to find the nearest cumulative probability in the cdf, k times, returning the indexes.
        Parameters:
        cdf - cumulative distribution function. NOTE that the values should be normalized such that the last item is 1.
        k - number of random selects
        rand - random number generator
        tolerance - tolerance for equality of doubles
        Returns:
        indexes from randomly selected cdf distribution values

      • chooseKFromBinarySearchFloor

        public static int[] chooseKFromBinarySearchFloor​(double[] cdf,
                                                 int k,
                                                 java.util.Random rand,
                                                 double tolerance)
        choose k indexes from the cdf by randomly drawing each time from rand[0,1] and using binary search to find the nearest cumulative probability in the cdf, then returning the index as the step that the random value truly belongs to).
        Parameters:
        cdf - cumulative distribution function. NOTE that the values should be normalized such that the last item is 1.
        k - number of random selects
        rand - random number generator
        tolerance - tolerance for equality of doubles
        Returns:
        indexes from randomly selected cdf distribution values

      • binarySearchForNearest

        public static int binarySearchForNearest​(double[] cdf,
                                         double srch,
                                         double tol)
        find the nearest value to srch in the array cdf using binary search. The runtime is O(lg_2(cdf.length)).
        Parameters:
        cdf - cumulative distribution function. NOTE that the values should be normalized such that the last item is 1.
        srch - number to search for nearest value of in cdf.
        tol - tolerance for the comparison to equals in comparisons of doubles.
        Returns:
        index in the cdf distribution whose array value is nearest to srch.
